name: methyl_4-cyanobenzoate

name: methyl_4-cyanobenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: The target compound methyl 4-cyanobenzoate is structurally based on a benzene ring which typically has a melting point around 5.5°C (benzene). The ester group (COOCH3) generally increases the melting point due to its polar nature and ability to form dipole-dipole interactions, potentially by +30 to +50. The cyano group (C#N), being highly electronegative and linear, could further increase the melting point due to dipole-dipole interactions and possible crystal packing effects, potentially by +40 to +60. However, the overall molecular symmetry and packing can also affect the melting point significantly, and may either increase or decrease it depending on the molecular structure.
